subject: Productivity
title: Chinese Civil Service Exams
description: A 60-second lesson on Chinese Civil Service Exams.

hook.text: China selected government officials through competitive exams starting in 605 CE. Merit beat birthright.

buildup.text: The imperial examination system tested literacy, law, and Confucian philosophy. Millions competed.

discovery.text: It created one of history's first meritocracies. Talent, not family, could determine your career.

twist.text: The system lasted over 1,300 years. European nations didn't adopt merit-based hiring until the 1800s.

climax.text: China proved that systematic talent selection massively improves institutional productivity.

punchline.text: Meritocracy was a Chinese invention, not a Western one.

quiz.question: When did China's civil service examination system begin?
